column3:
ACK

On Sunday, 17 January 2016, Andrew C notifications@github.com wrote:

> Fixed the download url of osslsigncode-Backports-to-1.7.1.patch file to
> 
> ## reflect its new location.
> 
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
> 
>   https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7360
> Commit Summary
> - Fix osslsigncode patch url
> 
> File Changes
> - _M_ doc/rel
ACK.\nnit: this PR could also include the now wrong SDK URL in the `.travis` file: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/.travis.yml#L19\n

Change URL to `http://`

SSL is not required here since all the other downloads are made over http and validated using hashes.

@btcdrak still 404.

Unless you mean where the travis build failed.

@achow101 I mean your PR must be changed to `http://`

Thinking again @cfields should probably move this to /depends-sources folder, I've messaged him on IRC.
I spoke with @cfields on IRC and he will update the URL to use `/depends-sources`\n

@btcdrak Can't we solve this using a redirect, in the same manner as #7351?

It is very possible for dev.bitcoincore.org to go away in the near future, so I prefer not hardcoding it in any way.

Thanks for taking care of this.

For future reference, the change has been merged upstream, but it hasn't made it into a release yet: http://sourceforge.net/p/osslsigncode/osslsigncode/ci/3be7eb1676a8af8afd9e0aa03e4cac651da14c23/

Unfortunately, it doesn't look like sf.net provides an easy way to extract a patch.
